fields.description:
Here is an example:

{code}
#!pytb
Traceback (most recent call last):
{code}

File "transformation.py", line 230, in <module>\\
result_data = main(report_file_name)\\
File "transformation.py", line 203, in main\\
result = handle_query_node(graph_db, data_node, user_sub, indices, dtusermod)\\
File "transformation.py", line 133, in handle_query_node\\
process = data_node.process

I used to be able to just past it in and there were {{{ holding it in.  Now these don't show up when inserting code.

It would appear that one can stil add the {{{ manually, but that doesn't work for me, and it seems like unnecessary work.
fields.summary: Adding a code snippet to an issue doesn't work like it used to

fields.description:
Thanks to the new comment functionality, it is now easier than ever to comment specific code. It makes it easy to review changesets and provide feedback to the code being submitted by the different members of the team.

A great addition to this functionality would be the possibility to automatically create an issue / enhancement / ... from the comment. You can see my original question / comment [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Marking%2Bup%2BComments%3FfocusedCommentId%3D306348228#comment-306348228].
fields.summary: Automatically create issue from a commit comment (BB-6171)

fields.description:
The dropdown that comes off the search field ends up behind the hero image rotator on the public (when not logged in) making it impossible to use items toward the end of the menu.

(Mac OSX Lion, Chrome Version 22.0.1229.92)
fields.summary: Owner/repository search suggestions dropdown on public home page is obscured by the hero slideshow (BB-6172)

fields.description:
We got DNS CNAME record pointed to bitbucket.org.

If you visit http://git.webtec.sk/webtec/topanky it will result in 404 - Page not found link.

If you visit https://bitbucket.org/webtec/topanky it is working.
fields.summary: Links doesn't work on own domains

fields.description: When you revoke access to a team followed repositories still show up in the master list.  You can unfollow only the repositories that have an issue tracker attached.  This happens for private repositories.  Would be great to get this fixed and reduce the clutter in my repository list.
fields.summary: Followed Repositories Bug

fields.description:
Hi there,

I created 2 repos:

test-project and test-project-2

i want to delete and re create them.

when i deleted test-project-2 it vanished completly - perfect.

however when i deleted test-project it deleted but still shows in my recent repos and shows the this repo have been removed message.

now when i try to create test-project again i get a kicked the bucket error...

also is there a way to permanently remove a repo like what happened with test-project-2?

Many thanks\\
Ben
fields.summary: Cannot delete and recreate repo

fields.description:
I'm a fluent commenter ... and since the new redesign I'm looking into replacing my current issue system with bitbucket.

So to make it a better experience.

# If you are adding a comment from the web, you are already "notified", so make it optional to receive an email notification.
# If the email notifications are disabled, however you are been mention on the comment, send the email notification anyways. Or better add a new option "Receive email notifications only if you are mentioned"
fields.summary: When you comment an issue, make it optional to receive an email Notification (BB-6173)

fields.description:
Hi,

I use a custom domain with my bitbucket account.\\
But when I use the repositories menu on the top bar, the links are not correct.\\
They still prefix the repository with my account name.\\
So instead of http://git.christianvermeulen.net/repo it links to http://git.christianvermeulen.net/christianvermeulen.repo.\\
This results in a 404.

However, when using the bitbucket domain, this is correct and the link works.
fields.summary: Custom Domain - Broken links

fields.description: https://bitbucket.org/akorn
fields.summary: Can not access my account

fields.description:
Today I'm getting this error accessing almost any page on Bitbucket:

Oops! An error occurred.\\
We've been notified and we'll look into the problem.

Guru meditation: 4f487366953a47f28b3d755c35f41e45$68b5b5970ef2fbfc502ff1997c1c49f9
fields.summary: "Oops! An error occurred." again

fields.description: Created account on BitBucket with Google OpenID, than deleted it, and now i cannot create an account with the same email.
fields.summary: Cannot create account after deleting it

fields.description: As you can see here [https://github.com/mitsuhiko/jinja2/tree/master/docs/_themes|https://github.com/mitsuhiko/jinja2/tree/master/docs/_themes].
fields.summary: Display readme in source browser for the directory you are currently browsing (BB-6174)

fields.description:
Currently within a pull request's Activity log, changesets links send the user to the target repository (where the changesets would be merged if the request was accepted).

However, until the request is actually merged in, those changesets don't exist (hence generating a 404); although the 404 page is nice, that's of no use. The changeset links in the activity tab of a pull request should send the user to the originating repository, like it is done is the Commits view, at least until the request is actually merged.
fields.summary: Changeset links in pull-requests Activity should send to the source repository (BB-6176)

fields.description:
On the repo pages, BB.debug is used to gate (at least) the GA tracking.\\
However, it has the value "false", which is truthy so the GA tracking code simply spams to console.log without actually making any tracking calls.
fields.summary: BB.debug == "false"

fields.description:
I just looked at the changeset for a merge commit, and it displays the first bunch of files without any problems, but once it has decided that it doesn't want to render any more files (ie instead of giving the diff, as the content it just says "This diff is too big for us to render."), it keeps using the same filename.

So assuming file_a through file_z it might be displaying file_a to file_s properly, but then every subsequent file is listed as file_t (at least I'm assuming it is displaying the correct number of files - the numbers look about right, but I didn't count them).
fields.summary: Same filename repeated on changeset view once the diff is too big too render (BB-6177)

fields.description: I deleted our iON repository but it's still in the list and can't create it again with same name.
fields.summary: Delete of repository

fields.description:
I've got a branch called "A#1_A", and when i try to compare to main branch i get: "spec must contain '..'".

Not sure if the "_" or the "#" is the issue.

I've noticed this issue with using dashes "-" too, e.g "A#1-A".

Can you confirm what the required conventions are for naming branches? Should probably be documented somewhere too...
fields.summary: Issues with Branch Naming (BB-6095)

fields.description: I've set up a link from my repo (atlassian/aui-archive) to my JIRA issues (AUI on EAN) a couple of times; but they're not persisting. Not sure if this is related to dogfooding the new system, eg. did links reset at launch? OR is this a legit bug?
fields.summary: jira link not persisting (may be atlassian-only issue)
Add ability to delete entries from the news feed

fields.description:
I cannot login using my team account email as something happened while I was registering.

The Email seems to have been added and will not let me create a new account as it says that the email exists. But I cannot log in or receive password reset for the account as it says the email is not associated with an account.

Please help.

The email is admin-dev@givemechocolate.me

Thank you.
fields.summary: Created Team account never got email

fields.description: With the new UI, there is no way to tell if a file was added/deleted/modified. Please re-add this as a feature.
fields.summary: Add icons for added/deleted/modified files in diff views (BB-6178)

fields.description:
If a commit message has the style

"""\\
this is the first line

here is a longer explanation, after a blank line\\
spanning several lines blah blah...\\
"""

the author cleanly intended the first line to be a summary and the rest a longer explanation. the "recent activity" list disregards the blank, starts reading the long explanation and truncates after a certain length.

The recent activity would have a better aspect if only the lines before the blank were retained: first truncate the message to the first \n\n, then apply the chars limit.

An example is again at https://bitbucket.org/dvarrazzo/psycogreen
fields.summary: Trim the commit message in recent activity on newlines (BB-6180)

fields.description:
https://bitbucket.org/dvarrazzo/psycogreen

after pushing new content to README.rst, the project page is not refreshed. I guess (I hope) the cached version is due to expire. However in case the readme is refreshed It'd be better to kill the cache immediately.
fields.summary: readme content not updated

fields.description:
Hi

I want to review all commits on my repository. I click on a commit and once I reviewed it I press "Aprrove". This is great but I would like two enhancements to it:

* When I am on a commits tab I don't see which commits I've reviewed and which not. It would be nice to add some flag/icon/color indication to the approved commits
* When I am looking in the commit page I'd like to quickly skip to next/previous commit in a list. Jira style "j/k" shortcuts would be great for this. (and maybe arrow icons too for those who don't use shortcuts)

Thanks\\
Dusan
fields.summary: Visual indication of approved commits (BB-6179)

fields.description:
Hey guys,

Absolutely love the interface overhaul! I'd just like to suggest you consider updating image assets to support the retina display on the new MacBook Pro. Its a shame to have fuzzy icons on this fantastic new interface you guys have made.

Thanks,\\
-Nick
fields.summary: Support for MacBook Pro with retina display (BB-6175)

fields.description:
On the Overview tab of a repository where you're presented with the SSH URL for the repository or the HTTP URL if selected the SSH URL is incorrect (I.e. in the section above Branch, Tags, Forks, etc.)

The URL shows - git@bitbucket.org:<username>/<repo_name>.git\\
rather than - git@bitbucket.org/<username>/<repo_name>.git
fields.summary: SSH URL incorrectly has colon instead of forward-slash between bitbucket.org and username on Overview tab

fields.description:
Reason: I just wanted to ask: “How to get out of a preview in a comment here?”

Then I found: “Ah, clicking preview again… might be useful to change the text in the preview button to “edit”, when the preview is shown.”
fields.summary: change the text in the preview button to “edit”, when the preview is shown (BB-6181)

fields.description: The CSS on ordered list seems weird to me. The font is a lot bigger than the rest of the text and the margins are huge as well. See attachment for a screenshot example.
fields.summary: css on ordered lists on issues is weird looking

fields.description:
Traceback (most recent call last):\\
File "setup.py", line 1, in <module>\\
from setuptools import setup, find_packages\\
ImportError: No module named setuptools
fields.summary: ImportError: No module named setuptools

fields.description:
When you're on page like:

http://bitbucket.org/user/repo/changeset/012ABC

Compare button should have url:

http://bitbucket.org/user/repo/compare/012ABC..

and Pull Request button should have url:

http://bitbucket.org/user/repo/pull-request/new?source=user/repo:012ABC:branch

In both cases it would select revision user clicked from in source pane of compare/pull request
fields.summary: Compare & Pull Request buttons on changeset page should lead to compare with current changeset selected (BB-6182)

fields.description:
I recently created the repository at https://bitbucket.org/kellettcommunications/acca.git. I have an existing local repository that used to be in Github that I want to migrate over to Bitbucket.

I removed all the original remote origin info from the repository configuration and added the Bitbucket remote origin. When I try to do the initial git push, I keep getting the following error and don't understand why:

error: RPC failed; result=55, HTTP code = 0\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly

This happens after a long timeout.

Using verbose mode does not give me any additional useful output.

Please advise.
fields.summary: Error pushing existing local repository to new remote origin

fields.description: I can't edit my comment if I click "Preview" button.
fields.summary: After click on Preview button in comments, can't back to editing my comment
Make user.bitbucket.org websites support the private flag like repositories

fields.description: There is currently no way to tell that the issue tracker is using Markdown, nor is there a link to the help page for this.
fields.summary: Add indication and/or help that new issues are now using Markdown syntax (BB-6077)

fields.description: We have about 30 users in our team and 50+ repositories. Everyone have and should have write access, but noe everybody are activly partisipating in all repositories. The repositories a user cares about changes over time, so they change the repositories they follow. The users only want to recieve notification about the repositories they follow. At the moment all users recieve notifications about all the repositories they have write access to. This causes a mountain of emails. Turning off email notification forces users to monitor BitBucket, that is not really an option, it becomes to hard to get a user's attention with mentions, issues etc.
fields.summary: Notifications are sendt everyone that have write access

fields.description:
Generally the new design looks slick and nice, but my first impression was “the header is too big”.

It looks similar to the google header, but clunky… It takes much attention away from the content.
fields.summary: first impression of new design

fields.description:
See the screenshot grabbed from the following URL: https://bitbucket.org/tuurngait/cog

The part that is weird/wrong is:

Alex G. uploaded file Cog.app.zipCog.app.zip to cog\\
Get Cog.app.zipCog.app.zip (9.9 MB).

The download link also leads to Cog.app.zipCog.app.zip, which results in a 404 error. The link on the repo's "Downloads" tab is correct and works.
fields.summary: Weird (wrong) filenames for downloads in repo activity stream (BB-6070)
Make admin 'Email addresses' error message friendlier (BB-6067)

fields.description:
I have a repository under a team account.  It is marked private, and no public forks.  In the access management of the repository, I have granted Admin access to the team's Administrators group, and Read access to the team's Members group.

When a Member of the team forks the repository, I expect that all Administrators of the team have at least Read access to the fork, so they can review progress and accept pull requests.  But apparently, the only one that can view the fork is the owner of the repository.  Other team administrators do not have Read access on the fork, so they cannot participate in administrating the repository by accepting pull requests.
fields.summary: Team admins don't have read access to forks of private repos

fields.description: Could you add syntax highlighting for the Dart language, please?
fields.summary: Syntax highlighting for Dart (BB-6071)

fields.description:
I don't see any easy way to browse all the files in a repo at a specific commit.  The UI provides the ability to view the files that changed but not the rest of the repo.

Further, there's no option for downloading the files in a repo at a specific commit as, say, a zip file.

I find these features (offered by Sourceforge's SVN browser and Github) to be very useful.  In particular, I want to be able to view the changes files in the context of the entire repo to think about how those changes might affect things.  We tend to spend a lot of time reverting changes as we go through our development and testing process (scientific software is a pain in the ass...), so this is a feature I use quite often on Sourceforge.
fields.summary: Browsing entire repo for specific commits

fields.description:
Before the release of the new UI, Bitbucket provided the exact commands for cloning repositories.

E.g, hg clone https://rnowling@bitbucket.org/rnowling/corr-ga

The new Bitbucket UI only provides the URIs (https://rnowling@bitbucket.org/rnowling/corr-ga) .

Although this seems like a small thing, it was a key feature that led me to prefer Bitbucket over Github.  Not only did it make my life easier (less thinking!), it was useful for members of our team and collaborators (researchers, scientists in math, biology, etc.) who are not as comfortable with the command-line and tools like hg and git.

Please, please bring this back!
fields.summary: New UI no longer provides commands for using hg / git

fields.description:
Wow, really irritating.

I don't mind a pattern on the password, but twice I entered extra team members, and it lost them on refresh when it warned me about a password pattern.  Keep the members or make it a different step!
fields.summary: Initial signup/password verification/loses team members (BB-6068)

fields.description:
If I am not mistaken, the old list just wrapped the long repository names. The new one makes it harder to navigate through them. For example, I have several repositories starting with the same prefix and I have to hover the mouse over the links to see the full name, which is not really convenient.\\
Please take a look at the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Long repository name is cropped in the repository list

fields.description:
Thanks for the new design. In-place repository filter is a nice feature, but the new repository list seems to be less practical than the old one, which displayed some additional information like private/public status and short repository description.\\
There was also a separate page showing detailed information about user's repositories, seems that is gone now as well. If you don't want to change the repository list, maybe bring back that separate page at least?
fields.summary: Improve the usability of the new repository list (BB-6072)

fields.description: "5 *coments* were made on this file in previous versions of this pull request"
fields.summary: Typo in previous version of pull requests (BB-6069)

fields.description: Would appreciate that a sans mono font be used when displaying the README file on the repo front page (e.g. https://bitbucket.org/IndigoJo/qtm-1.3 ), the same as when displaying other source files on Linux and Mac OS X - they are much easier to read than Courier or other serif mono fonts. Might do to specify commonly used sans mono fonts in the CSS.
fields.summary: Use sans mono font for displaying README

fields.description:
In a wiki, if I create a {{[[link]]}} to a page that doesn't exist, I expect that the link would be formatted differently (such as: in red) and that clicking on it would give me the option to create the missing page.

Right now, i just get a 404 error and it seems that I have to manually create a page with the right path - really interrupts the authoring flow.

I'd like the feature of, if I have rights to edit, to be prompted "This wiki page doesn't exist yet.  Create it now?" and then go straight on to editing the new page.
fields.summary: Wiki dead link -> "Create Page" rather than 404
Some URLs in Markdown are parsed incorrectly

fields.description:
Current font spacing in rst rendering can really be improved via couple small css-changes. Please take a look at that.

http://screencloud.net/v/AxaK

Thanks!
fields.summary: better rst rendering fonts -- spacings, sizes etc. (BB-6073)

fields.description: It would be nice if the readme text could show images from the repository itself
fields.summary: Showing image from the repository itself

fields.description: Deleted key for privacy as this is a public issue tracker.
fields.summary: Invalid SSH key (ssh-keygen).

fields.description:
I had a few problems converting a user to a team.

I fixed it by filling in my username in the hidden input that seemed like it should be being populated by checking a tickbox when nominating the administrators, and then removing the disabled attribute from the submit button through chrome developer tools.

Once I did that, it appeared that the team was created as expected.

This was using Chrome on OSX.
fields.summary: Converting user to a team

fields.description:
Hello,

I have a problem setting up an account on bitbucket. When I attempt to create an account (Team) and invite other people from my company I get this error:

https://www.evernote.com/shard/s14/sh/1e30252a-3b85-435e-8f1a-aab2ed053454/a4bd38d60dc92aa6e9a0e080aa0ec70a

I'm not sure: should I invite p.josiek@futuremind.com to bitbucket first somehow? Or does he have to be a registered user?

Regards,\\
Tomasz Koperski
fields.summary: Problem setting up account

fields.description:
We have a custom domain git.test.cloud.fi that points to bitbucket.org and has been configured a custom domain in the account settings.

When I access git.testcloud.fi, I correctly end up on the (testcloud) team page. If I select one of the repos on the right hand side repo list, I correctly end up on the repository page at git.testcloud.fi/<repo name>. However, If I choose repo from the top nav bar repos dropdown, I am taken to the git.testcloud.fi/testcloud/<repo name> page which does not exist
fields.summary: Cannot access wbe pages for repositories using a custom domain name

fields.description:
Hi,

I am using Ubuntu 12.04 with chrome.\\
The background of the "getting-started" element is overlaping the stats box icons.

Apart from that the new design rocks!

cheers,\\
John
fields.summary: <h2 id="getting-started"> is overlapping <ul class="stats">

fields.description: Escaping double slashes /~/ <- OK?
fields.summary: Wiki tilde escapes are displayed

fields.description: It would be great to be able to set a short 'description' for each download file and preferentially label them as 'featured' in order to make it easy for users who, by mistake, land on the project page.
fields.summary: Improved 'Downloads' tab w/ descriptions and 'featured' items

fields.description:
This is a paragraph.

h1. list item 1
h1. list item 2
h1. list item 3
fields.summary: Font size/weight of Wiki list is too large/heavy! (BB-6065)

fields.description: Site not render properly on IE7 and 8.
fields.summary: Site not render properly on IE7 and IE8

fields.description: Bookmarks act as branches in repo overview page, click link which id is branches-dialog-trigger. Then click any bookmark in branches dialog, repo source page tell me {{The branch 'bookmark_name' does not exist.}}
fields.summary: Source browser displays "branch does not exist" warning when browsing at an hg bookmark revision (BB-7243)
Wiki notation 'pre' does not work.

fields.description: The idea behind a wiki page is to be informative but be public. When I say semi-private I mean that only contributors can modify wiki-pages on a projects where as private wiki's need to give out the ability to view it. But public wiki's anyone can mess with something without really asking the administrators.
fields.summary: Read only wiki (BB-6080)

fields.description: When a readme.textile is present in the repository, it gets rendered auto-magically, which is good. However, when the first line of the readme.textile has an h1. markup tag (or any other heading tag), that tag seems to be ignored, and instead it is just written out, all subsequent heading tags seem to work correctly.
fields.summary: Readme.textile rendering the h1. tag incorrectly when displayed in overview (BB-6183)

fields.description: If you look at the repo at https://bitbucket.org/pcastellazzi/dotp-2013-dlc/src you may find xml files are not syntax highlighted when viewed if the name contains only capital letters.
fields.summary: Syntax highlighting is properly applied when file names are capitalized (BB-6184)

fields.description:
The "Recently Updated" repository list points to the wrong link if you're accessing BitBucket through a CNAME.

For example:

http://hg.example.com will link to http://hg.example.com/[team name]/[repo name]

when it should link to:

http://hg.example.com/[repo name]
fields.summary: Links in Repositories dropdown in new UI links to wrong place if using a CNAME (BB-6061)
The new bitbucket look bombs in IE8

fields.description:
I follow repositories in order to stay abreast of code changes, not changes in popularity. Sometimes my timeline contains a dozen or so follow/unfollow events that don't interest me:

{code}
Joel Brauer began following pellepim/jsTimezoneDetect
2012-10-03

Radu Vultur began following pellepim/jsTimezoneDetect
2012-10-01

Mladen Krivacevic stopped following pellepim/jsTimezoneDetect
2012-09-24

Mladen Krivacevic began following pellepim/jsTimezoneDetect
2012-09-24
{code}
fields.summary: Timeline should only show follow/unfollow events for one's own repositories (BB-6059)

fields.description:
I don't use ID-connectors or at least I try to circumvent them as often as possible. While connecting content as much as possible is a good thing, connecting authoring is more bad than good. At least in my point of view.

So for those people who feel the need to be always recognized (and honored), give them gravatar. But please for the rest of us give us the possibility to directly upload a user picture.
fields.summary: Enable uploading a user picture without the need for Gravatar. (BB-6060)

fields.description: Cannot find a link anywhere to delete a repo.
fields.summary: Deleting repos

fields.description:
Executing the "/users/{username}/events" REST API call results in a truncated list which is missing a lot of events that should be public and are visible on the BitBucket website.

For example:

curl -i "https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/users/thedillonb/events/?start=0&limit=30"

{\\
"count": 1,\\
"events": [\\
{\\
"node": null,\\
"description": null,\\
"repository": null,\\
"created_on": "2012-10-04 00:24:08",\\
"user": {\\
"username": "thedillonb",\\
"first_name": "Dillon",\\
"last_name": "",\\
"is_team": false,\\
"avatar": "https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/5ce4051edf2dd7a41c0d9f438f869b1a?d=https%3A%2F%2Fdwz7u9t8u8usb.cloudfront.net%2Fm%2F96c49f640214%2Fimg%2Fdefault_avatar%2F32%2Fuser_blue.png&s=32",\\
"resource_uri": "/1.0/users/thedillonb"\\
},\\
"utc_created_on": "2012-10-03 22:24:08+00:00",\\
"event": "start_follow_user"\\
}\\
]\\
}

However, if you check my profile you'll see there are a lot more entries that are missing...
fields.summary: REST API: User Events Missing Entries (BB-6187)

fields.description:
It would be a cool feature to browse the source of an older revision directly from the commit history of a project by a simple link like github has one (I made a screenshot of it). The ability to show the source of a specified revision seems to be already there: https://bitbucket.org/[user]/[project]/src/[revision hash]

Thank you for your great service ;-)
fields.summary: Include a link the from the commit list view to the source browser at the commits revision (BB-6057)

fields.description: I know it's an old technology, but there are still quite a few ASP pages out there.  Not the ASP.NET/VB.NET variety, but the .asp.  Any chance you can add that as a language (or perhaps VBScript?).  What about the older Visual Basic code as well?  There are still quite a few production applications that rely on these technologies.
fields.summary: Add VBScript (ASP) and Visual Basic Languages (BB-6056)

fields.description: Tables on Wiki pages have no styling whatsoever, not even basic borders. Tables are not viewable this way.
fields.summary: Wiki table styling

fields.description: In the repository overview, in the box on the right containing "Owner", "Acces level" and other stuff please add field with programming language.
fields.summary: Add info about programming language (BB-6053)

fields.description: I have created a few issues in my project and prior to interface changes everything was fine. Currently on the dashboard bugs are shown as created by anonymous but when I review them in issue tracker everything is working fine.
fields.summary: Self created issues reported as anonymous

fields.description:
Use-Case:\\
Create two repositories A and B.\\
Navigate to Repository A.\\
Navigate to Repository B.

Observation:\\
"Repositories"->"Recently Viewed" list shows repositories in order of creation, not in order of last visited.

It shows "Repository A" at ordinal 1, in this case.

Customer Expectations:

My expectation for this feature is to bring the repository most recently visited to the top of this list.

If not, then switching between 5+ repositories will be a pain in the face.
fields.summary: Recent List not updating

fields.description:
Uploading signed commits (using git commit -S), will display the whole signature instead of only the commit message in the web UI.\\
This makes the commit overview basically unusable.\\
A first step would be removing the signature from the web display, ideally the signature could even be verified and display a corresponding icon to indicate valid or invalid signatures.
fields.summary: Support for GPG-signed commits

fields.description:
This issue is exactly the same I've posted for bitbucket's old design (#4725) so I will repost it for the new one.

When I open a page of my project on bitbucket.org I see a top menu related to this one. It has an item "Issues (count)" that refers to page with a list of currently open issues (with "new" or "open" statuses).

Working for relatively long time on my project I mentioned that the count of open issues in menu item is not equal to the count of issues in page's title (that is just above issues' list and represents a valid value). To be more precise, the count of open issues in menu item is less than the count in page's title by one. E.g, when count of open issues is 14 I see "Issues (13)" in menu item.

I'm not sure whether such behavior correct or wrong but probably there can be page's caching issue.

A problem becomes apparent on my private repo's page: https://bitbucket.org/Arrenda/arrenda.ru/issues?status=new&status=open
fields.summary: Open issues' count in project's "Issues" menu item is wrong. (BB-6058)

fields.description: I would like to convert my account to tem and although I select an administrator the create button doesn't let me go on, error message is 'You must nominate at least one developer as an admin.'
fields.summary: could not convert to team (BB-6090)

fields.description:
Use-Case: trying to get free users on my account by inviting others (no matter how loser the others are)

Result:\\
The visual overlay displays validation error upon submission.

Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 400 (BAD REQUEST) - https://bitbucket.org/!api/1.0/invitations/toddpi314@ninjastar.com

In this use-case, I volunteer to be the loser-invite 'toddpi314@ninjastar.com'
fields.summary: Can't invite noobs

fields.description:
First of all, thanks for the nice UI overhaul.

In the new UI, when rendering reST files, such as overview page with README.rst, section headers (turned into <h2> tags) are hard to distinguish from normal text contents.  Used to be in bold (font weight) in the old UI.
fields.summary: reStructuredText section header rendering (BB-6051)

fields.description: It seems in the new UI, repository website URL (the one that can be set in "Repository details") is nowhere to be found.
fields.summary: Missing repository website URL in new UI (BB-6052)

fields.description:
I have the name that appears on my passport, and I have the name I use all over the place on the web. I would prefer the name I use all over the place on the web be the one that shows up in most contexts, even though the name on my passport is not a secret.

So I would like a 'Display name' option on the account information screen alongside the fields for 'First name' and 'Last name'.
fields.summary: I would really like a 'Display name' for Bitbucket

fields.description: Use the ruby highlighter.
fields.summary: config.ru syntax highlighting (BB-6046)

fields.description: Use the ruby highlighter!
fields.summary: Gemfile syntax highlighting (BB-6047)

fields.description:
When viewing commits list for particular repo, author name is not shown.

Using Opera version 12.02

Our ellipsis overflow is making the name disappear in Opera.
fields.summary: In Opera long author names show as blank in the commits view (BB-6050)

fields.description:
In the list of commits (URL: /<username>/<projectname>/changesets), let’s have some UI to select any two commits and see a diff between them.

A possible UI might look like this: every commit has a little icon to its left which symbolises “diff”. When you click on one, it just gets depressed. Perhaps a message could show somewhere to invite you to click on another one. Once you click on a second one, the page reloads and a diff between the two commits is shown.
fields.summary: Ability to diff between any two *commits* (not revisions of a single file) (BB-6045)

fields.description: See attached screenshot, event "Shu Zong Chen reported issue BCLOUD-295 to mchaput/whoosh" was associated with me ("Shu Zong Chen") when it should be "davewillmer".
fields.summary: News Feed event associated with wrong user

fields.description: When I choose a commit and click in the zone to add a comment, a little (?) help button appears at the right of the page, left of the Preview button. When I click it, I'm thrown at a new tab page, showing the Log-In/Sign-Un page for Atlassian (url: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Marking+up+Comments ). That wasn't very helpful of course.
fields.summary: help button leads to atlassian sign-in page

fields.description: After I'm logged into my acct., I don't see a place to browse/explore other repositories (other than search w/ empty). Am I missing something, or have you hidden this on purpose?
fields.summary: browse/explore repos? (BB-6044)

fields.description: Why on EARTH are you clipping the repository logo inside a circle!? Everybody's logos look terrible now. If I wanted my logo in a circle, I would put it in a circle. It's not like this change accomplishes anything in terms of technical or usability improvements, it's just change for change's sake, and it makes my (very good) logo look terrible. Please revert this change!
fields.summary: Clipping repository logos inside circles is stupid

fields.description:
Right now if I opt to see the diff for a commit that has multiple parents (i.e., a merge), the system chooses one of the parents, seemingly by random, to diff against.

Quite often it is not the parent I want, and I cannot find any way to diff against the other parent.

To make this easy, I think the list of parents that is currently shown in the top-right of the diff could be augmented with radio buttons to select which one to diff against.

Please don’t make me go through a more complex UI that presents me with all changesets to choose from. Such a UI may be useful to have so that you can diff between any arbitrary revisions, but for the common case of diffing against the parent, we should be able to do this with a single click.
fields.summary: Ability to diff against any parent (BB-6054)

fields.description:
See the attached screenshot.

The top is the 'Repository Details' page where I can set the description of a repo.

The bottom is the repos overview page where the description is shown.

Neither html or newlines are translated, giving the overview page a very clumsy look and feel
fields.summary: Repository overview page should use markdown for the description (BB-6048)

fields.description:
"Invite a friend" popup didn't accept {{roman.sergey@********.com}}, but accepted {{romansergey@******.com}}.

Thank you for that great product!
fields.summary: Didn't like a dot in the email address id

fields.description:
The email address is valid. I have tried this with more than one address. They do not contain any special characters; in fact when trying the same address but with the google trick of +something, it works. For example user@gmail.com is invalid (already registered actually), whereas user+bitbucket@gmail.com is valid.

The error message is incorrect.
fields.summary: Inviting existing user's email address gives error "Please enter a valid email address. " (BB-6049)

fields.description: When Looking at the commits of a repository These Little Curly Lines at the legt are not füllt visible, Somerset Part of the left end is missing.  Using an iPad on iOS 5.
fields.summary: Commit Lines (BB-6043)

fields.description:
It would be nice if you provided support for Darcs (http://darcs.net/).

Thanks in advance,\\
Polarina.
fields.summary: Darcs support

fields.description: Is it normal to follow myself ? :) The new design is awesome! Good job.
fields.summary: Following bug ?

fields.description:
I'm pretty sure the way reStructuredText is rendered is worse since the redesign. See for example https://bitbucket.org/dvarrazzo/psycogreen

The most serious defect is the titles with more space below the title than above, visually destroying the document structure.

Here is how the competitors shows it: https://github.com/dvarrazzo/psycogreen
fields.summary: Rendering of reST document much worsened
